page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content:
Most of the block lies in the Ecclesiastical Parish of{Holberton}but the western area is in the Parish of {Revelstoke}and includes the old Parish Church of St. Peter the poor fisherman spectacularly situated on the sea cliff near Stoke House.
The Church was disused in 1881 when Lord Revelstoke provided a new Church at Noss Mayo outside the block but in recent years St.Peters has been half restored, it is still a consecrated buiding and open air Religious Services are held there. The tower is originally beleived to have been a Saxon Peel Watchtower.
